intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: So Iago has failed yet again. Pitiful. I'll have to dispose of him one of these days... No matter. Plan B will spring into action anytime now. Oh...and to see the look on Corrin's face when it does... Bwahahaha!

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: No, Father... How could you?

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Hello, Elise. Might I ask what you're doing out here?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Gah! Xander, don't spook me like that.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Be honest—were you spying on Father?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: ... Yes.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Elise. You should know better. Father would not be pleased if he found out someone was listening in on him. Even you would likely face some unpleasant consequences.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: I know. It's just... *sob*

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Elise! What's wrong?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: I don't know what to do! Corrin is gone... Leo is gone... Camilla is so depressed that she hardly even leaves her quarters. What's happened to our family, Xander? How can we go back to the way things were?

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Elise... Don't worry, Sister. When this war is over, everything will go back to normal.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: *sniffle* R-really? But how can you be so sure?

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Because I believe. That's why I can keep fighting in the face of heartache. We must all believe that what we're doing is for the greater good... We must trust in our cause and fight for it with all we have! That's all we can do, at least for now.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Well, we had to take the long way around, but we're finally here. This ferry will take us right to your childhood home, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I know. I'm having a hard time believing this is really happening.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Yeah, well, don't get too nostalgic or anything. As soon as we step off this boat, there won't be any place to hide.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You're right. We should begin preparing for battle now. There won't be any time to rest once we reach the dock.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Before we get to that, I need to brief you on something, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Just before we boarded this vessel, I received a message from Yukimura.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Really? How is that possible?!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: He sent a young pegasus rider from the Bottomless Canyon to find us. Both rider and steed appeared exhausted. Sakura is tending to them now.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see. So, what was the message?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: It's bad news, I'm afraid. Yukimura reports that the royal troops are still holding the line in Hoshido. But it appears that soldiers from Mokushu have joined Nohr in attacking us. It sounds like it's only a matter of time until our defenses are breached.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: It gets worse. That message is at least several weeks old. I wouldn't be surprised to find that the situation has deteriorated even further.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It sounds like we don't have much time left. We need to defeat Garon and end this war before our castle falls. How long until we reach our destination?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Another day—maybe two. According to the captain, we need to go far upstream to reach a docking point.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: But...according to the map that the Rainbow Sage gave us...our destination is directly across the river from us. Why can't we go straight there?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Hmm. I'm not sure. The captain didn't indicate that we had any options.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Look. Right there. A port marked Demon's Fall on the map.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Demon's Fall? Show me!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: He's right. It's handwritten very faintly, right there. Have you heard of the place, Ryoma?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Yes, but I believed it to be a legend. They say it's a waterfall made of fire, which seemed too fantastical to be true.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Perhaps it's worth checking out. It could save us a few precious days.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Well, we better decide quickly. We're coming up on a fork in the river!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I believe it's worth a shot. What do you say, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I agree. We must act quickly...or else there may no longer BE a Hoshido to save. I think we're ready to take on anything we might find at Demon's Fall. Who's with me?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: We're all with you, Corrin! I'll inform the captain.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: By gods...the waterfall IS on fire!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Yes. It is a strange phenomenon, but I can explain how it came to be. There is a massive reservoir of oil nearby that has mixed with the water. At some point, hundreds of years ago, the river was set aflame. It may have been a lightning strike, or an accident, but regardless... It has burned ever since. All of us living in Nohr have avoided the general area, for obvious reasons. So naturally, there doesn't appear to be any sort of a path for us to follow.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Hmm...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Corrin, do you see that statue over there? I feel the presence of a Dragon Vein nearby...maybe even two!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Be careful! I also sense a hostile presence in the area...

boss.speaker: Stoneborn
boss.line: None shall pass. Your life ends...here.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What's happening? Is this another of Iago's traps?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: A cave! That wasn't here before, was it?

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Jakob, is that...what I think it is?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What are you two talking about? Care to enlighten the rest of us?

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: Do you feel that breeze? It's fresh air, coming from that passageway. Unless I'm mistaken, it will take us directly to the capital of Nohr, Windmire. There were rumors of such a thing, but I never knew it actually existed...

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Yes, if what they suspect is true, this passage would be a massive shortcut.

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: The air is unmistakable. But I don't see why the path would lead here...

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: The Rainbow Sage must have known about this.

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: O-or maybe he built the secret path himself!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Yeah? Well then why didn't he just tell us about it? Sure woulda saved us a lot of trouble and guesswork...

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Hey! The Rainbow Sage gave us a hand-drawn map. What else do you want from the guy?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Yeah, yeah. I know. Maybe he didn't tell us directly becaus he knew we still had a rat problem. I can just see the traitor now, telling the Nohrians our EXACT route...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi...do you truly believe there is still a spy among us?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: I'd like to believe not, but...we haven't exactly had the best luck so far.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: There's no time to debate this. Not when we're about to enter Nohr proper. Now is a time for unity, not division.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That's right. We're probably going to have to face off against Xander and Camilla soon... But I'm prepared to fight even them, if I have to. Hear me, King Garon—we're coming for you!
